Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor broke up Bowden Francis’ no-hit bid with a tying homer in the ninth inning.
Francisco Alvarez added a three-run shot.
The Mets scored six times in their last at-bat.
Sean Manaea struck out eight in 6 2/3 innings, allowing one run and three hits.
Danny Young (4-0) got one out in relief to help the Mets win.
Addison Barger had an RBI single off Ryne Stanek with two outs in the bottom of the ninth.
George Springer followed with an infield single.
Edwin Díaz earned his 18th save in 24 chances.
Pete Alonso hit a sacrifice fly.
Starling Marte chased Green with a sacrifice fly.
Génesis Cabrera gave up a first-pitch homer to Alvarez, the seventh of the season for the Mets catcher.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor said, 'It felt really good. It was one of those hits that I could tell the vibes in the dugout were lifted.'
Toronto manager John Schneider said, 'It sucks for him that it’s happened twice in the same fashion.'
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said, 'He just got us going. Special player, special person.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bowden Francis lost his second no-hitter in the ninth inning during one season, becoming the first pitcher to do so since Hall of Famer Nolan Ryan with Texas in 1989.
Francis was selected AL pitcher of the month for August, when he went 4-1 with a 1.05 ERA.
Davis Schneider made a great catch at the wall in the bottom of the sixth.
The Mets honored first responders with special caps.
Lindor needed time when a wasp landed on his glove at shortstop in the bottom of the sixth, and second base umpire Stu Scheurwater helped out by whacking the wasp with his cap.
